question.content:
For shipping purposes, foam mattresses are rolled tightly into cylinders. The volume of the cylinder is significantly less than the volume of the mattress when it is laid out as rectangular prism. For the sake of this problem, let's say that the volume of the rolled up mattress is exactly half of the laid out mattress.

The dimensions of the mattress when it is laid out are...

What is the radius of the mattress when it is rolled up into a cylinder.

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
